In his keynote speech delivered at the opening ceremony of the Seminar on Green Development and Desertification Prevention and Control Audit, Mr. LI Feng, Deputy Auditor General of SAI China, emphasized combating desertification and restoring degraded land and soil under SDG 15 as one of the most important sustainable development goals. Mr. Li Feng also focused on INTOSAI WGEA‚Äôs efforts to realize this sustainable development goal by formalizing an audit framework ‚ÄúAuditing Guidelines for SAIs on Land Use and Soil Quality Management for Combating Desertification‚Äù published in 2019.

Vice Chair of the INTOSAI WGEA Mr. Hussain Niyazy participated in the SAI20 summit held in Belem, Brazil with a special focus on climate finance, energy transition and poverty eradication. In his speech, he noted the critical role that major economies have in the global environmental and climate stewardship and the significant contribution of the SAIs in the SAI20 to the working group. In terms of climate financing, he emphasized the need for national targets, agreed international definitions and the importance of ensuring effectiveness. Auditor General Niyazy also highlighted the ongoing works of the WGEA in enhancing the capacity and capabilities of SAIs in environmental and climate accountability. The communique of the summit is available here: https://lnkd.in/dqChm3vp

Participants of the Seminar on Green Development and Desertification Prevention and Control Audit hosted by SAI China visited a photovoltaic power base at the Tengger Desert, which is a key supporting project of the power transmission channel aiming to develop a desert photovoltaic base and transmit new energy. After the base's completion and grid integration, annual electricity generation will reach 3.96 billion kWh, saving 1.207 million tons of standard coal and reducing 3.2938 tons of carbon dioxide, which plays an important role in promoting the development of new energy system featuring as clean and low carbon consumption, safety and efficiency.

Mr. Ibrahim Aiman, Assistant Auditor General of the Auditor General's Office, Maldives which is Vice Chair of INTOSAI WGEA, delivered a speech at the opening ceremony of the Seminar on Green Development and Desertification Prevention and Control Audit at Yinchuan, China. In his speech, Mr. Aiman highlighted the published and ongoing works of the WGEA in the subject matter, the major impacts and subtle links of desertification in a globalised world and the importance of complying with relevant legislative requirements, inclusive of the United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification. #desertification #environmentalaudit #asosaiwgea
